verses.verse: These <WH428> are also<WH1571> proverbs<WH4912> of Solomon,<WH8010> which<WH834> the men<WH376> of Hezekiah<WH2396> king<WH4428> of Judah<WH3063> copied out.<WH6275>
It is the glory<WH3519> of God<WH430> to conceal<WH5641> a thing:<WH1697> but the honor<WH3519> of kings<WH4428> is to search out<WH2713> a matter.<WH1697>
The heaven<WH8064> for height,<WH7312> and the earth<WH776> for depth,<WH6011> and the heart<WH3820> of kings<WH4428> is unsearchable.<WH369> <WH2714>
Take away<WH1898> the dross<WH5509> from the silver,<WH4480> <WH3701> and there shall come forth<WH3318> a vessel<WH3627> for the refiner.<WH6884>
Take away<WH1898> the wicked<WH7563> from before<WH6440> the king,<WH4428> and his throne<WH3678> shall be established<WH3559> in righteousness.<WH6664>
Put not forth thyself<WH408> <WH1921> in the presence<WH6440> of the king,<WH4428> and stand<WH5975> not<WH408> in the place<WH4725> of great<WH1419> men:

For <WH3588> better<WH2896> it is that it be said<WH559> unto thee, Come up<WH5927> hither;<WH2008> than that thou shouldest be put lower<WH4480> <WH8213> in the presence<WH6440> of the prince<WH5081> whom<WH834> thine eyes<WH5869> have seen.<WH7200>

Go not forth<WH3318> <WH408> hastily<WH4118> to strive,<WH7378> lest<WH6435> thou know not what<WH4100> to do<WH6213> in the end<WH319> thereof, when thy neighbor<WH7453> hath put thee to shame.<WH3637> <WH853>
Debate <WH7378> thy cause<WH7379> with<WH854> thy neighbor<WH7453> himself; and discover<WH1540> not<WH408> a secret<WH5475> to another: <WH312>
Lest <WH6435> he that heareth<WH8085> it put thee to shame,<WH2616> and thine infamy<WH1681> turn not away.<WH3808> <WH7725>
A word<WH1697> fitly<WH5921> <WH655> spoken<WH1696> is like apples<WH8598> of gold<WH2091> in pictures<WH4906> of silver.<WH3701>
As an earring<WH5141> of gold,<WH2091> and an ornament<WH2481> of fine gold,<WH3800> so is a wise<WH2450> reprover<WH3198> upon<WH5921> an obedient<WH8085> ear.<WH241>

As the cold<WH6793> of snow<WH7950> in the time<WH3117> of harvest,<WH7105> so is a faithful<WH539> messenger<WH6735> to them that send<WH7971> him: for he refresheth<WH7725> the soul<WH5315> of his masters.<WH113>
Whoso <WH376> boasteth himself<WH1984> of a false<WH8267> gift<WH4991> is like clouds<WH5387> and wind<WH7307> without<WH369> rain.<WH1653>
By long<WH753> forbearing<WH639> is a prince<WH7101> persuaded,<WH6601> and a soft<WH7390> tongue<WH3956> breaketh<WH7665> the bone.<WH1634>
Hast thou found<WH4672> honey?<WH1706> eat<WH398> so much as is sufficient<WH1767> for thee, lest<WH6435> thou be filled<WH7646> therewith, and vomit<WH6958> it.
Withdraw <WH3365> thy foot<WH7272> from thy neighbor's<WH7453> house;<WH4480> <WH1004> lest<WH6435> he be weary<WH7646> of thee, and so hate<WH8130> thee.
A man<WH376> that beareth<WH6030> false<WH8267> witness<WH5707> against his neighbor<WH7453> is a maul,<WH4650> and a sword,<WH2719> and a sharp<WH8150> arrow.<WH2671>
Confidence <WH4009> in an unfaithful man<WH898> in time<WH3117> of trouble<WH6869> is like a broken<WH7465> tooth,<WH8127> and a foot<WH7272> out of joint.<WH4154>

As he that taketh away<WH5710> a garment<WH899> in cold<WH7135> weather,<WH3117> and as vinegar<WH2558> upon<WH5921> niter,<WH5427> so is he that singeth<WH7891> songs<WH7892> to<WH5921> a heavy<WH7451> heart.<WH3820>
If <WH518> thine enemy<WH8130> be hungry,<WH7457> give him bread<WH3899> to eat;<WH398> and if<WH518> he be thirsty,<WH6771> give him water<WH4325> to drink: <WH8248>
For <WH3588> thou<WH859> shalt heap<WH2846> coals of fire<WH1513> upon<WH5921> his head,<WH7218> and the LORD<WH3068> shall reward<WH7999> thee.
The north<WH6828> wind<WH7307> driveth away<WH2342> rain:<WH1653> so doth an angry<WH2194> countenance<WH6440> a backbiting<WH5643> tongue.<WH3956>
It is better<WH2896> to dwell<WH3427> in<WH5921> the corner<WH6438> of the housetop,<WH1406> than with a brawling woman<WH4480> <WH802> <WH4079> and in a wide<WH2267> house.<WH1004>
As cold<WH7119> waters<WH4325> to<WH5921> a thirsty<WH5889> soul,<WH5315> so is good<WH2896> news<WH8052> from a far country.<WH4480> <WH776> <WH4801>
A righteous<WH6662> man falling down<WH4131> before<WH6440> the wicked<WH7563> is as a troubled<WH7515> fountain,<WH4599> and a corrupt<WH7843> spring.<WH4726>
It is not<WH3808> good<WH2896> to eat<WH398> much<WH7235> honey:<WH1706> so for men to search<WH2714> their own glory<WH3519> is not glory.<WH3519>
He <WH376> that<WH834> hath no<WH369> rule over<WH4623> his own spirit<WH7307> is like a city<WH5892> that is broken down,<WH6555> and without<WH369> walls.<WH2346>
